title: Olly Hartley: Saracens centre signs 'long-term' contract extension
title_page: Olly Hartley: Saracens centre signs 'long-term' contract extension - BBC Sport
maintext:
Saracens centre Olly Hartley has signed a new "long-term" contract with the Premiership club.
The 23-year-old joined the London outfit from Wasps in 2022 and has made 37 appearances since.
Hartley suffered a serious knee injury in April at the end of last season.
He returned to the playing squad in November and has featured in 11 matches in all competitions.
Hartley, who also represented England A last year, said he was "keen to get stuck in with this younger core of players and see where we can go as a squad".
Saracens director of rugby Mark McCall added: "He has shown real strength of character over the last 18 months to overcome serious injury and we are certain Olly has all it takes to realise his incredible potential."
